title: Zeros of $S$-characters
abstract:
The concept of $S$-characters of finite groups was introduced by Zhmud as a
generalisation of transitive permutation characters. Any non-trivial
$S$-character takes a zero value on some group element. By a deep result
depending on the classification of finite simple groups a non-trivial
transitive permutation character even vanishes on some element of prime power
order. We present an example that this does not generalise to $S$-characters,
thereby answering a question posed by J.-P. Serre.
